Art

Glitch Art

I glitch photos of places undergoing rapid climate change and/or ecosystem collapse, like Alaskan glaciers and coastal communities. My code, along with a jupyter notebook, is available here

This work was chosen for the 2019 Creative Climate Awards and shown at the Taipei Economic and Cultural Office in 2019.

Firn Cores

Photo Credit: Hannah P. Mode

While working as a member of the research faculty on the Juneau Icefield, I hand-drilled some firn cores to look at how the density of firn (old, compressed snow) changes with depth. I worked with Hannah Mode on to try to visually record the density using cyanotypes. A write up of the work with images can be found here.
